text:
Question 86) Empedocles establishes four body elements - fire, air, water and earth - which are eternal and change increasing and decreasing by mixture and separation; But the principles themselves, by which those moved, are love and hatred. For it is necessary that the elements remain alternately in motion, sometimes mixed by love, sometimes separated by hatred. Simplicio. Physics, 25, 21. In: The pre-Socratic. São Paulo: Nova Cultural, 1996.
The text proposes a reflection on the understanding of Empedocles about Arché, a typical concern of pre-Socratic thinking, because
A) Exalts philosophical investigation.
B) transcends the sensitive world.
C) evokes the cosmogonic discussion.
D) underlies human passions.
E) corresponds to mythological explanation.
